intro: Psoralea hypogaea subsp. scaposa, commonly known as the scapose psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish to brownish flowers that are typically arranged in racemes, and its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
